posts.title: Designing for trust in fintech onboarding
posts.excerpt: Trust cues are not just visuals; they reduce cognitive load and shorten time to activation.
posts.content: In fintech, users are cautious. Start with transparent copy, visible security cues, and clear timelines. A short checklist with progress indicators can reduce anxiety. You can also use pre-filled data to make verification feel lighter. The goal is to keep the user in control while guiding them forward.
posts.author: Rohit Diggi

posts.title: The 3-layer UX audit
posts.excerpt: A quick audit method to spot high-impact issues without a 50-page report.
posts.content: Layer one checks clarity: does the user know what happens next? Layer two checks friction: what steps can be removed? Layer three checks persuasion: where is the proof and why should the user care? This lightweight framework helps teams prioritize fixes in days, not weeks.
posts.author: Rohit Diggi

posts.title: From research to launch: a 5-week cadence
posts.excerpt: A cadence that keeps velocity while improving quality across teams.
posts.content: Week 1 is discovery and alignment. Week 2 is flow + UX prototyping. Week 3 is high-fidelity UI and handoff. Week 4 is build support. Week 5 is launch and measurement. This rhythm keeps product and engineering aligned with minimal drift.
posts.author: Rohit Diggi
